website_summaries.verdict: This is an ideal all-around choice for those who seek an ecologically sensitive all-terrain hiking boot that will still look stylish at night.
pros: Environmentally conscious construction using many recycled materials
cons: Soles are not durable, as they may separate from upper
Stitching is more decorative than functional

customer_reviews.title: SUPER COMFORTABLE BUT ( *INFERIOR* )SOLES & OR GLUE USED. THE SOLES COME APART AFTER A WHILE .
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS MY 2ND PAIR OF THESE BOOTS WHICH ARE VERY STYLISH & COMFORTABLE BUT AFTER A WHILE OF WEAR, THE SOLES BEGIN TO COME APART FROM THE SHOE . ALSO THE STICHING ON THE TONGUE OF THE BOOT CAME APART. GREAT LOOKING BOOT BUT DISSAPOINTING QUALITY.
customer_reviews.author: Willy Gabela

customer_reviews.title: Just don't last.....
customer_reviews.text: Loved the boot. Comfortable and stylish but they use a cheap adhesive for the soles and trust me, your sole will separate. No doubt about it If you're going to buy these just know going into it they will fall apart. Only question is how soon You'd think a brand like Timberland would make a change to the quality of such an iconic design because its necessary
customer_reviews.author: Little Everywhere

customer_reviews.title: NOT work boots.  Awesome otherwise!
customer_reviews.text: The boots are very nice if you keep in mind that they are NOT work boots. More like a sneakers that look like boots. The leather is super soft and not waterproof. I treated mine with Sno-seal for waterproofing, it works but completely changes the look of the boot. The size is way off, you should follow timberland’s advice and order a full size smaller. I usually wear 9.5-10 and ordered a 9, it could have been a bit smaller. Also, the boot has almost no arch support so you will need an insole if you are flat footed like me. Other than that they are very comfy.
customer_reviews.author: Leo P

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: I really like these boots. They have a rugged look but, refined enough for casual wear. They are very comfortable and fit true to size. These aren't as thick and heavy as my Wolverine 1000 Milers but, they weren't intended to be. Great all around outdoor boot for moderate conditions with a great grippy sole. At this price point I can't find anything that competes on quality of goods or construction.
customer_reviews.author: John B.

customer_reviews.title: Great boots! Order one full size smaller!
customer_reviews.text: I am a 9.5 shoe size 99% of the time but with these a 8.5 fits perfectly. I read lots of reviews in regards to sizing and decided to order one full size smaller than my regular size. These boots are extremely comfortable and have virtually no break in period. I treated them with mink oil to darken and protect the leather. I love the style and comfort of these boots and recommend them to anyone looking for a quality boot.
customer_reviews.author: Brenden L.

customer_reviews.title: Too big and poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Please listen to the reviews- these are far too big, at least a size and a half. The shoes are starting to separate after four months. I don’t typically trust timberland quality anymore but I really liked the look and style of this boot so I took a chance. Since then, I’ve found similar styles from better companies. Don’t take the gamble.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Like Them
customer_reviews.text: Great casual boot. These are my bad weather go-to boots for work (office environment). They’re not heavily insulated but work well with a good sock. I’ve only had them for a couple of months, so I can’t attest to long-term durability; however, they seem well made. They break in quickly and are very comfortable. My only criticism is they don’t have a finger hole in the back to help pull them on, but dear mom whaaaa. Good boots.
customer_reviews.author: Bump77

customer_reviews.title: Good looking, but quality isn't totally there
customer_reviews.text: Boots look good, leather is very nice. Stitching is good, with exception for the tongue. This will be a problem after awhile. Laces are cheap, but got lock laces anyway. At 145 bucks I expected more, have had Timberland boots before and were worth every penny. But these seem lower in quality then the previous ones I own/owned.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Love these boots!
customer_reviews.text: These boots are awesome and I've gotten so many compliments. I've had them about a year now and I could not be happier. A little waterproof spray for added protection and the recent Colorado winter was no match for these boots. The sole is softer/grippy, which is great for stability on wet surfaces, but obviously will wear faster than a harder rubber. Side note, these are not hiking boots or work boots, but damn they look good.
customer_reviews.author: Pjdnvr

customer_reviews.title: Great boot!
customer_reviews.text: This is just a first impression review but they look and feel great. The leather is of a good quality and they seem to be made very well. The only issue of note is that they absolutely do run a 1/2 size larger. I’ve always wore a 10 in practically everything and that fits me perfect and for these boots I had to get a 9.5 to get the same fit. Just keep that in mi d.
customer_reviews.author: Akeel Omar Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Returned cause of scratches, but good boots
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots other than the fact that I was sent a return where some douche canoe scratched a smiley face into the leather with their fingernails. It wouldn't buff out, so I sent it back. Ordered another pair from Timberland (paid more but that's life I guess). So, good boots just check your vendor and make sure they don't send you garbage. Excellent color, excellent fit.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Cearley

customer_reviews.title: Quality pair of boots
customer_reviews.text: Please read the special instructions prior to ordering. I normally wear a size 14 and initially ordered a pair of 14s. The boots were too large and I had to immediately return. After reading the fine print that recommends to order one size down, I ordered a size 13 and they fill well. The boot is till somewhat large in the width but a thick pair of socks solves that issue. Overall an nice looking and comfortable pair of boots.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great style, poor performance
customer_reviews.text: Pros: stylish and comfortable, comes in extra wide size option Cons: waterproofing is marginal at best (if you submerge your foot in a big puddle, don't expect dry socks), and though the treads look rugged, they provide little to no traction on slippery surfaces. The laces are high quality, but eyelets instead of holes all the way up would make lacing much less time and labor intensive All in all, a great boot for style and comfort (especially with a Dr. Scholls performance sport insole) but poor performance in winter conditions. I've had them for a few months and they seem durable enough so far.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy John Kudrik

customer_reviews.title: I purchased these boots for my husband after he requested ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these boots for my husband after he requested a pair of study but supportive leather boots. I wanted to get him a pair of shoes that would last but had a different loot compared to the standard "Timberland" boots. Long story short he absolutely loves them and says they are very supportive as well as stylishly modern. You can't go wrong with these shoes. I will update in the future if anything changes.
customer_reviews.author: HoustonMama

customer_reviews.title: Decent boot
customer_reviews.text: Great looking boot, much lighter than the 6” boot. Leather is much thinner (hence the lighter weight), so thin that the tongue and stitching came loose (really, Timberland?). Does not take the wax as well as other Timberland boots, I have to wax them after each time i wear them. I acknowledge I am writing this review months after purchase, but these observations hold true. The torn tongue was a surprise, since these are Timberland boots and a certain quality is expected. I wear these boots casually, not for work or activity.
customer_reviews.author: Moses serna

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: A lot of people said these fall a part quickly, so far mine seem to be in good a condition as any other boots I bought. They do run 1.5 size too big. I normally wear 12, I bought 11, but I think 10.5 would have been perfect. But the 11 will work fine. They are a wide boot. I almost bought the wide sizing... So glad I didn't. I'll update if anything negative happens.
customer_reviews.author: Engstrom

customer_reviews.title: 100% as expected!
customer_reviews.text: funny story about this purchase is that I saw this shoes for the first time back in 2012, and when I saw them I didn't have the money to buy them, so I kept a capture photo in my email, turns out that few days ago (year 2020) I was erasing old mails and saw the shoes.. I started to look for them and turns out that they were the same price as in 2012!! I bought them immediately!
customer_reviews.author: Manuel Escalante

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, comfortable, rugged urban wear
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful boots. Best of all they are casual boots. I wanted the weather protection that a boot offers for my grueling trips to and from the car parking lot to the office door, or stomping through the paved city streets, but I had no desire for Arctic thermal protection, deep water fording, a steel toe and then an uncomfortable, restrictive 10lb boot. These are all day comfortable, soft and supple out of the box, and with a nice boot sock are plenty warm. I applied a liberal coating of Obenauf's Heavy Duty Leather preserver, are they are now completely water and snow proof.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Ellazar

customer_reviews.title: How to buy your first pair of Tims🤙🏾
customer_reviews.text: I’m a standard US 8.5 size shoe. I ordered (4) pairs because I ordered “W”ide per my foot. I finally settled with 7 regular and even still, I realize that the leather will eventually stretch & become “loose”, which I wish didn’t; but it’s the nature of the leather. Only solution with be to get a 1/2 size smaller, which at the end, may not be comfortable in the long wrong. Best advise would be to try the size in store & make sure you get the correct fitting prior to buying online.
customer_reviews.author: Circa_75

customer_reviews.title: Great stylish boots
customer_reviews.text: One of my favourite boots that is eco friendly too! Wish this was waterproof and had just abit more insulation but it was not designed as a winter boot. I just use it as one but thicker sock can be accommodated without sacrificing room. Runs abit larger so generally most go a half size down like most boots.
customer_reviews.author: Xavier

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: Great boot. I have high arches so I bought the New Balance NB400 orthotic insert and this boot is now very comfortable. Looks great and has been with me all over the country. Boot looks even better with mink oil applied to it. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Herrmann

customer_reviews.title: So far so good! these boots are extremely comfortable right out of ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! these boots are extremely comfortable right out of the box! they look great and they feel great. even smell great! that real leather smell. however the tongue does feel like it's pretty weak and I think I could rip it off if pulled hard enough. I'm taking these boots hiking and I'll see how they hold up. hopefully they perform well because so far I love them. I wear a 9.5 in Nike shoes and these boots fit me in an 8. definitely try to put these on for size before purchasing
customer_reviews.author: Daniel E. Lee

customer_reviews.title: UNACCEPTABLE !!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've had these boots for almost 3 weeks and the soul is peeling from the top of the boot, comfortable as can be, they feel great and as a previous owner of 2 earthkeepers, I am SO upset that these boots are falling apart already. I guess I will have to return and go with another company.
customer_reviews.author: Skyler Selhorn

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed Customer
customer_reviews.text: Initially, these boots were great. They were comfortable, durable and looked good. After my first week, my legs began to get red clusters on the skin between my boot line and my ankles. This was after wearing these regularly (4-5x/week). I had to get 2 steroid prescriptions over the period of 4 weeks to get them to go away. My doctor said it was an allergic reaction to the leather treatment. Since I wear other leather boots and shoes, I can only point to whatever Timberland used for these boots.
customer_reviews.author: Mister Smith

customer_reviews.title: Totally disappointed, not durable at all.
customer_reviews.text: Fairly comfortable, look pretty good, but have begun to fall apart faster than any shoes I've owned in recent memory. Both soles have begun to separate after only 4 months of maybe 2-3x weekly wear, mostly to work in an office. Totally unacceptable. I've never had the same thing happen to any Clarks, Rockport, or other price comparable brand show or boot I've owned.
customer_reviews.author: JdoubleH

customer_reviews.title: Sizing is way off, possibly a whole size.
customer_reviews.text: I was really looking forward to these boots. Purchased a 12, I am a 12 in every shoe I own. The boot looks awesome and felt well made. When I put them on they seemed to be"longer" than I am used to. I checked the stamp on the inside and it was correctly stamped 12. But these boots were clearly larger, maybe even by a whole size. Returned item. Take caution when purchasing and read return policy. As a Prime member the description said free returns, when I picked my size, that option seemingly disappeared. Only valid if fulfilled by Amazon, be aware.
customer_reviews.author: Gee Buttersnaps

customer_reviews.title: Sizing way off!
customer_reviews.text: The boot itself is fine, however Timberlands sizing is completely off. Their sizes run about 1 to 1 1/2 Sizes too large. (So if you’re normally a size 10, you’ll need a 8.5 or 9) This makes buying them online very difficult. If you’re buying them on Amazon expect to have to return a couple pairs. If your set on buying these, you may want to try them on in a store first.
customer_reviews.author: sharon raboin

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart after 1 month of light wear
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my 16 yr old son for Xmas. He has had them for about 1 month and the tongue of one boot is pulling apart at the stitching. He loved the boots initially and has taken great care with them, even avoiding wearing them when it rains. He does not wear these boots daily and when he does wear them its basically to and from school. Very light use yet the boot is falling apart. We are just outside of the 1 month window to make a return. Currently trying to get a message to the seller to inquire about a replacement but not having much luck with that either.
customer_reviews.author: Tara C.

customer_reviews.title: ... a pair of Timberland's many years ago and never liked them. But my boots were wearing out so ...
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a pair of Timberland's many years ago and never liked them. But my boots were wearing out so decided to give these a try. Figured worst case scenario I could try them on, and if they were uncomfortable I could return them to Amazon. Turns out these boots are pretty great right out of the box. The leather is good quality and is decently soft to start. Breaking these boots in was no problem at all. They were pretty dang comfortable from day one. I will say the stitched for some of the patches wasn't quite symmetrical between the pair. Doesn't really bother me though. They are a solid pair of boots.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Look Fantastic--You'll Want Hiking Socks--Soles Wear Fast, But Uppers Are Great
customer_reviews.text: Great looking, and offer a comfortable fit as long as you wear thick hiking socks or double up. As I've noticed more detailed reviews mention, the soles do seem to wear down awfully fast, but I plan on getting them resoled because the uppers look great, fit well, and are very durable. I don't usually tie mine. I have them laced all the way up and put knots on the ends of the laces to keep that way. I lace them up when I'm actually hiking, but when I'm only walking a few miles they're comfortable just laced up--& they're easier to slip on and off that way.
customer_reviews.author: Hawkeye

customer_reviews.title: Way to large
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews. Some said they were a size and a half bigger. I didn't listen. They are indeed a size and half to long. I wear 10.1/2ww. The width was perfect but the length was a size and a half too long. They refunded me as soon as I dropped them off at UPS.
customer_reviews.author: bryan taylor

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: These run small and narrow. Not that comfortable. They are just ok boots. Definitely not the quality level of a boot for this price range. I’ve owned these for 2 months now and the sole is starting to come loose.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good looking, comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Waterproof, good looking, comfortable, light. They aren't for hiking but I took them on an 8 mile hike one day and they felt totally fine. The sole started to detach from the bottom from the boot after about 2 months of wear. It was mostly cosmetic but could have gotten more serious if I had neglected the problem for several weeks. I fixed the problem that weekend using some shoe repair glue. Easy fix so I wasn't too disappointed. I would give 4.5 stars if possible.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Great boot but not exactly a snow boot.
customer_reviews.text: I followed the suggestion of some of the reviews I read before purchasing. I got a half size smaller, I'm usually a size 11 and I got a 10.5. They fit very well on my wide food. Great amount of toe room. The boots are waterproof as advertised. I was a little hesitant thinking that they weren't but thankfully they are. But they are not a snow boot. There is not real insulation within the boot. I have been wearing them around Philadelphia during a record 14 inch snow storm and temperatures between -15° and 20° and my feet are a little bit cold but I picked up some nice wool socks. Hiking wool socks probably the best choice.
customer_reviews.author: Oxy

customer_reviews.title: Have them resoled with a Vibram sole and get some fused tip laces and they will last you years like mine. I realize these boots
customer_reviews.text: THESE ARE NOT HIKING BOOTS, rather fashion boots disguised as utility boots. In any case, they will put in work if you take them hiking. Sole is very weak in my opinion and these are not waterproof at all. All that being said, they are quite durable. Have them resoled with a Vibram sole and get some fused tip laces and they will last you years like mine. I realize these boots never claimed to be hiking or outdoor boots but thats the impression they give. If you want them for such use looks for something else. Again, still a decent boot.
customer_reviews.author: the_gelatinous_cube

customer_reviews.title: stylish and functional
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these boots looking for a practical and fashionable shoe that would compliment my active lifestyle and style of dress. The boots are durably made with solid construction. The design reflects an intelligent balance between functionality and progressive styling. This is a shoe I can wear to the clubs and to the woods and feel equally comfortable in both environments. The lace up design allows me to feel secure and versatile in mobility while the lined, cushioned interior insures that my feet feel supported. This is an excellent shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Masud Olufani

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with these Timberland boots
customer_reviews.text: Not happy with these Timberland boots. Sole came off the first one within 3 months! Bought a second pair, now the second pair is coming apart from where the shoe lace ties to! timberland used to be high quality, now its trash! My old timberland boots from 10-15 years ago, still going strong, but the new ones are just falling apart!!!!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: boots fall apart fast- dont buy
customer_reviews.text: I bought these boots for use every now and then. I like the fit, but they are poorly manufactured. The tongue is coming apart from the shoe as the stitching is poorly done (other reviews comment on the tongue as well). The sole also has worn out extremely fast, it is a very soft rubber compound. While the soft rubber makes it comfortable, its just wears down fast. I can live with the sole wearing out, but never had I purchased shoes that stitching failed before the sole. This is especially bad for a shoe that the sole wears down so fast. Would I buy these again- definitely not.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots, the shipping well...
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots, they fit great, keep your feet dry, very comfortable. Since I got them I can't take them off my feet! So the shipping... Well I bought these boots on a impulse with the intention of using them for my Halloween costume on Saturday night 10/26. I bought them on Friday, I paid for the upgraded shipping to have the item overnight to me... Well Saturday nights party came and when and I was Timberland Earthkeeperless.... The shoes ended up arriving that Monday 10/28. In the end I'm not devastated because they are awesome boots but Amazon guaranteed delivery by 8pm 10/26 and I paid for the upgraded shipping!
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Believe the hype. These are amazing boots. I work construction and I’m 315 lbs. These boots are almost indestructible and support your feet for days. 9/10.
customer_reviews.author: JBUICE

customer_reviews.title: I love these Boots !
customer_reviews.text: Really great boots! I wear an 11 normally but I only.went a 1⁄2 size down and got a 101⁄2 and they fit perfectly. Just enough extra room for a better and thicker sole insert .
customer_reviews.author: Booberilla

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these boots for my son. This pair makes number 3. He picked these boots out when he was in college, so I got them for him to wear. They are his go to boot. Now he is married, still wearing his boots. One weekend while visiting he mentioned that his boots was looking pretty bad. So I played it off, because he had a birthday around the corner and I thought that would be the perfect gift. So I ordered him a pair off of Amazon and had them shipped to his house. They it in time and he is a happy camper!!
customer_reviews.author: Robin L Ramer

customer_reviews.title: Great boot way too big, not true to size
customer_reviews.text: Boot looked very nice and well built, but way too big. I order the "Used Like New" sold by Amazon and was a little skeptical, but was pleasantly surprised, they looked brand new! I would order at least a full size smaller than the size you usually wear.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Very slippery no traction
customer_reviews.text: The size and fit are ok but not very comfortable though. The major problem is with the the soles they have no traction and are very slippery. When wet they make a loud squeaking noise very slippery To the point where they are very dangerous you can fall down and hurt yourself. I've never had shoes or boots that are a hazard like there. Whatever plastic material they use is not intended for the soles of shoes.
customer_reviews.author: James A.

customer_reviews.title: Product was not what I ordered
customer_reviews.text: I did not receive the color boot ordered; Instead of the burnished brown color, I received a darker color boot that indicated the color was medium brown on the box. Very disappointing to receive something that was not exactly what I ordered. This is an expensive boot and should arrive as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Nichole

customer_reviews.title: Bought them in March, Soles are slowly coming unglued
customer_reviews.text: Spend your money elsewhere, bought these in March and the soles are coming unglued. For the amount of money spent, it's ridiculous. Gave them two stars because these shoes look exceptional; they're leather, but the glue that holds it all together is the worse.
customer_reviews.author: Gerardo V.

customer_reviews.title: Fit
customer_reviews.text: Just got these but am very pleased on first look. They are well made and the fit is perfect. I wear a 10.5 and the size is spot on. I did go with the W since the tops of my feet sometimes hurt with a regular width.
customer_reviews.author: Eyekayak

customer_reviews.title: Top notch boot but get protection too
customer_reviews.text: Top notch boot. Waited about 2 months of daily wear to make sure I could give it an accurate review. Perfect for me because it looks good enough for the office and is tough enough for the mines and construction sites that I often work at. Comfortable for all day wear. Be warned it does show wear easily so I recommend getting a waxed leather protector. Something like that keeps it good as new. I use the timberland waxium but I’m sure there are others on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Dillon Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Go down a size
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for my husband. They are great looking boots, however they run big so consider getting a whole size smaller, if not at least a 1/2 size. Both boots arrived with scuffs on them as if someone had previously worn them. We ended up returning them but plan to repurchase the correct size.
customer_reviews.author: rorangel13

customer_reviews.title: Way too big
customer_reviews.text: I wear 11.5 US and order 9.5 US. I can still put two fingers into the space between my heel and the back of the boot. I tried to compensate with thick wool socks but still not a solid fit. Three stars for the really horrible sizing by Timberland. Will be returning these and hopefully get a better fit next go around.

customer_reviews.title: Stay Freah
customer_reviews.text: These are just AWESOME! Feel great, Look Great J-u-s-t AWESOME! Stay Fresh
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Kaleniecki

customer_reviews.title: 000 worth of boots on Amazon before I came across this pair that fit nice, were comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I must have ordered ~$1,000 worth of boots on Amazon before I came across this pair that fit nice, were comfortable, reasonably priced and look great. Normally I wear a 10.5 in most shoes and have a wide foot, but have never bought a wide size. After trying on many boots and them being too narrow I decided to search ones that came in wide. I initially ordered these in size 10W because I read that they run large. They were still large and I ordered a 9.5W that fit good. I could have probably even gone down another half size.
customer_reviews.author: S.K.

customer_reviews.title: Slippery when wet
customer_reviews.text: I bought these boots to be my daily shoe around the city. They fit fairly well, running a little large but other reviews have already said that. What I did not expect was for them to have so little traction! Walking on anything that isn’t concrete or dirt when it’s raining can leave you slipping and sliding. Not to mention that once you go inside and the boots are wet they are quite loud.
customer_reviews.author: M C.

customer_reviews.title: these are great. I use these when riding on my motorcycle
customer_reviews.text: Rugged look; these are great. I use these when riding on my motorcycle. Left toe is not getting scuffed at all after after several months of riding (averaging 1,200 miles a month through town). Sole does not slip and is comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: sam

customer_reviews.title: Nice pair of boots!
customer_reviews.text: To clarify, these are not my old boots (insulated Sears Diehard) but those were purchased for Winters in Ohio. In California elements are not as severe so insulation not required. That said, these boots are well constructed, comfortable (for boots) and flexible when walking. The sole and heel have a non-slip design for mud and snow etc, but no real thermal qualities! Not steel toed so don't try it! These are perfect boots for CA--just need thicker socks for trips to the snow but provide great protection otherwise! Kudos
customer_reviews.author: Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Look great, but poorly made
customer_reviews.text: A good-looking, durable, reasonably priced shoe is impossible. These are great-looking, somewhat reasonably priced, somewhat poorly made boots. Would probably work great for someone who treats shoes with care, but if you're a walking commuter/blue collar worker, these boots won't hold up long. Lots of loose threads to cut off before they snag on something and the upper falls apart, and after one month the sole is separating at the front from the leather. Used some automotive epoxy in the gap and it seems to hold, but I don't expect it'll be for long. These boots can't take much of a beating.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Savage

customer_reviews.title: Low Quality...don't be fooled by fake reviews.
customer_reviews.text: These are low quality, folks - many of the reviews on here sound fake. Thin material, very flimsy heals. " Fashionable boots"....not function. For the same price: BATES ( I wore mine for six years in the Marines and never saw a single pair fall apart.) Or CARTHART: Steel toes, water tight, weather proof etc. You might order these and be happy, just know that much better pairs are out there.
customer_reviews.author: Frost

customer_reviews.title: Runs large, order a full size down
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable out of the box and stylish. As others have noted, the size is large. For reference, I wear a size 11 in Asics running shoes and a size 11 in Cole Haan dress shoes. I ordered these in a size 10 and they fit just right.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver

customer_reviews.title: Holding up fairly well.
customer_reviews.text: It's been about 6 months now and they're holding up really pretty good. Haven't had problems with the tongue yet. There's only one spot where the threading/stitching is appearing to come loose. I'll just put some epoxy on it. Anywho, they feel great and fit great. I usually wear a 13 Converse, which is slightly loose for me, but I have super wide feet, so I have to. I ordered 12 W US and they fit really pretty good. At first it was a bit uncomfortable and snug, but after a while the leather fit to my foot. Best purchase I've made all year.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: style over durability
customer_reviews.text: Fits me well, I have a wider than average foot. I had hoped to use these at work, I'm a rail roader, but these do not seem durable enough for actual work use. These do look pretty sharp and I wear them out from time to time. They have a sort of old school, ww2 era look.
customer_reviews.author: J. Silvia

customer_reviews.title: A Fantastic Boot, A Fantastic Buy
customer_reviews.text: The durability and workmanship of these Earthkeeprs is first rate, but more importantly, the footbed is the most comfortable I have ever worn. I am on my feet almost all day, and these boots keep my feet comfortable, and above all, cool. They are also extremly light because because they're not packed with cushie liner, or heavy outsoles. As to size, they run true (for me) I should wear a 10 B-width narrow, but the Timberland medium is a true medium: not as wide as boat, and the toe box and length are absolutely perfect. Bravo, Five Stars!
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Nice but not the same.
customer_reviews.text: I've worn Timberland chukka style boots before. My last pair was my favorite pair of boots. The dog liked them more than I did and chose to eat the left one. These boots just don't seem to have the same quality as my last pair, even at an increased cost of $50. The leather seems much thinner. These are very lightweight. They also seem to run just a little large, maybe 1/2 size. These are for casual wear. They're still comfortable and they look nice.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Good stylish boot
customer_reviews.text: Really like these timberland boots they look good feel light and have some good cushion on the sole. They do fit loose I usually wear 9 1/2 size sneaker and size 10 boot, these do run a little big even with wool socks on, the other issies is don't expect your feet to stay dry if you walk through anything more than a 2 inch deep puddle these seem to be more for going out on nicer days I really like them though.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: V POOR QUALITY, WORE OUT WITHIN HOURS
customer_reviews.text: Great looking boots but very disappointing quality. The soles came apart after the 2nd time I wore it and it was indoor. I read some reviews before I bought it. Many complained about quality but I was shocked how quick it wore out.
customer_reviews.author: Raed Ghandour

customer_reviews.title: Wrong color...
customer_reviews.text: besides the fact that they fit bigger than your normal size ( recommend you to order one size below) In my case I'm 13 and that size feels like 14 but also tried 12 and feels to tight. I ordered 3 times the same pair of boots and every single time they sent the wrong color. Returned all of them, bought them somewhere else.
customer_reviews.author: J Parada

customer_reviews.title: Great boots!!
customer_reviews.text: I really like how the boots look and feel. They pull on and off easily too. I would give these 5 stars except that I ordered them in "BURNISHED BROWN" and got them in "MEDIUM BROWN NUBUCK." The color doesn't bother me though. Overall though they are really good boots! Like some of the other reviews say, order a size smaller than you usually wear because they do come big. I usually wear around 10.5 or 11 and I got 10 and they are slightly big.
customer_reviews.author: Tristjt

customer_reviews.title: looks great, very comfortable, falls apart
customer_reviews.text: looks great, very comfortable, but - fell apart after a single hike. I know actual hiking isnt what most people are going to do with these boots but I really expected them to be up to a single overnight trek without falling apart. 14miles and the sole is coming off front and back on both shoes. Very disappointing. Unfortunately this hike was more than 30 days after purchase so unable to return Update - had them resoled twice since purchase. Like them so much its worth the expense but really shouldn't have had to
customer_reviews.author: BK MJN

customer_reviews.title: Good feel
customer_reviews.text: These are the most comfortable boots I have to yet to have worn. It only took me two days to break them in. I have had them for at least four months now and they still feel like they did on day 3. I might look around for other boots in the future, but I feel safe repurchasing these because of how comfortable they are. They are definitely not for rigorous work- more of the type of boot I would wear in a warehouse, ship, walking in snow, rainy days, and maybe to an interview.
customer_reviews.author: A. Savage

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Found a tiny hole on the side of the boots on my second time wearing it. Return window is closed and i can't even return it for an exchange. A total rip off!
customer_reviews.author: John Q

customer_reviews.title: Looks, feels great
customer_reviews.text: It's true these shoes run large, order a full size smaller than you normally would. They look great! I've had them for about a month and they're very comfortable for everyday use. Not sure if they would make good "work boots" but they're very comfortable walking around in. I have slightly wide feet but I got them in the regular width, they broke in pretty fast and easy. I'm not used to wearing boots, I find they're a bit of a hassle to put them on/off. So I think in the future I'll look for something with a side-zipper.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Look great, quality could be better
customer_reviews.text: Stitching started coming undone after wearing for two months. Just wear for office work so no strenuous activity in them.
customer_reviews.author: Sieve29

customer_reviews.title: Earthkeepers are dope!
customer_reviews.text: Great looking boot, very comfortable and stylish. Great fall/winter look. Runs a size small. I wear size 9.5 and I ordered a 8.5 based off other reviews and they fit perfect. Def would recommend if you're looking for a cross between a casual/dress boot.
customer_reviews.author: David Austin

customer_reviews.title: Souls peeling off
customer_reviews.text: Great looking boot that feels comfortable, when they say order a size smaller they really mean it. I wear a 10 1/2 and I bought 10 I should of went with a 9 1/2. Only thing wrong is the soul on both boots are coming off. All I do is walk in them. For the price and them saying that it's a rough and tough boot it's just not true. Haven't even had them for a year yet and they're just peeling from the soul.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes, although I bought a size smaller than ...
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes, although I bought a size smaller than normal. I knew this ahead of time because this is my second pair, first pair lasted the better part of 5 years for daily use. I usually wear a 9.5 in Nikes but 8.5 for these. I'll buy another pair after these wear out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome boots!
customer_reviews.text: These boots are amazing. It's great how I can pair these with formal and casual outfits.
customer_reviews.author: Anish

customer_reviews.title: Not real. Sole is coming off.
customer_reviews.text: I don’t think these a legit timberlands. They are already falling apart at the sole with very limited use. They look great but I feel like I was ripped off.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: I covet these boots
customer_reviews.text: Love these boots. I normally wear a 9.0 - 9.5 but an 8 fit me the best after initially ordering a 9.0. Well made, unique and were comfortable immediately. Too pricey to use for work but I can’t wait until they’re beat up and I can wear them all the time.
customer_reviews.author: RMoreno

customer_reviews.title: Fashionable and great quality!
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear a large 13 or a 14, and this only came in size 13. So I ordered that, as I fell in love with the style of the boot, and it fit perfectly! If you have a wider foot, this will be fine. I take very good care of my shoes, and have polished these and kept them in the box when not wearing them. After about a month of wear, I haven't noticed a terrible amount of scuffing, but even scuffed and beat up these would look great. Happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: John Cole

customer_reviews.title: A little large, but wear thick socks
customer_reviews.text: I agree with other reviewers that they are a bit large. I normally wear a size 11, ordered a size 10.5 and theybarevstill just a smidge large. Possibly could have gotten away with a 10, but didn't want to deal with the return hassle. Don't forget that with boots like this, you're supposed to wear thick socks, so that makes it a good fit for me in in the 10.5s. Overall, though, great look, good quality, and comfortable. I've only worn them twice, but I expect them to continue molding to my feet (benefit of leather).
customer_reviews.author: GL

customer_reviews.title: and they are still doing pretty well. One of the small leather loops halfway ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm a few months into moderate/light use of these, and they are still doing pretty well. One of the small leather loops halfway up the tounge has fell off (for no real reason, other than it was poorly attached) - but that hasn't effected the overall function. I still am very happy with the look of these boots, even if their cost was perhaps slightly high for the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Silva

customer_reviews.title: Stylish Mens Boots along with Durability!
customer_reviews.text: I really like these stylish boots and they are comfortable at that! These boots feel very well made and have a lot of craftsmanship with some durable stitching. They are the most comfortable boots that I have put on in a while now and well worth the money to me. You know sometimes you have to pay for quality and you can feel and see it in these boots! The fact now that I have worn these boots to work numerous times because they are more comfortable than my new balance tennis shoes ought to tell you something!!!
customer_reviews.author: coxm75

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I read all the reviews from people saying order a full size smaller but decided to go a half size smaller instead and I'm glad I did. It's a comfort issue with me. My feet have room but are not swimming around in my boots. I also wear thicker than normal socks in the cold weather months (just the weather these boots are made for) so I feel like I have the perfect size, and did I say they were comfortable. Were it not for the fashion police I could very easily wear these everyday (thinks maybe I'll get them in another color...)
customer_reviews.author: Brotha J

customer_reviews.title: Waaay more comfortable than expected
customer_reviews.text: I live in Minnesota and needed a good boot for winter but wanted a stylish boot as well. These are much more comfortable than I was imagining they would be and they look fantastic. Very happy
customer_reviews.author: Andy Walsh

customer_reviews.title: A little larger than usual
customer_reviews.text: As my title states, the boots run a little on the large size due to lack of thick padding material on the interior of the boot. But it's OK for me since I use these on trails and wear thick socks to compensate. So far I've probably put a good 150 miles of trails on these bad boys and they are just as comfortable as the day I first put them on. They require no break in since they are already super soft. My only gripe is they wear much faster than any shoe/boot I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Awesome boot
customer_reviews.text: Great quality and style. I would suggest using some mink oil before wearing out. I used some and it gave the shoe a darker better look. I would say it lost one star because i am a size 11.5 and ordered a size 11 which was a little big. I also bought insoles for this book because the insoles seem very flat and will wear out in no time. Worth the extra time and care for this boot, you would pay easlier $100 more for anything similar with the same quality.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Run big, but love it.  Breaks in quickly.
customer_reviews.text: Get a half size smaller than you normally wear for perfect fit. Run a little big.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: They run a little big
customer_reviews.text: Gr8 looking boot but too loose. Big for my original size that I wear. I actually went a 1/2 size smaller cause I heard they ran big. But it looks like I have to run a size and a half smaller, other than that gr8 looking boot
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Lugo

customer_reviews.title: Sharp but run big
customer_reviews.text: Very sharp. But they’re a little big and floppy. Consider 1 less size.
customer_reviews.author: nryan

customer_reviews.title: A Little Large but Still Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: When these boots came I was disappointed that they were a bit large even on my massive feet. However, the first time I took them on a hike I was wearing my extra thick hiking socks and they fit perfectly (after I tightened up the lases as much as possible). The boots look great, but be warned that they are pretty easily scuffed up and mine were a bit more of a bright clay color than the picture shows. I still love these boots to death though, and they're great for hiking or just walking around. They're super-comfortable and I totally recommend them to anyone needing a comfy outdoor boot.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Wertz

customer_reviews.title: Perfect boots but get 1 size down
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear a 12 and got the 11 as instructed for a perfect fit. These are some of the best looking boots I've ever had. I wear them casually so can't speak to ruggedness but build quality is very strong.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Galloway

customer_reviews.title: I want to give more stars but....
customer_reviews.text: The first pair I received I had to return because the stitching started to come apart on the tongue. The second pair has been fine, until the other day, now the stitching on both tongues has come apart! I love these boots, super comfortable and they look great, but the stitching is crap! I am going to get them fixed myself, I wear a 15W and it is really hard to find good boots at a decent price so I'm willing to put up with these annoyances.
customer_reviews.author: Kalyn Gibson

customer_reviews.title: 1/2 size down
customer_reviews.text: I knew Timbs are sized a bit large going in. Half size down worked for me. Leather seems good. Sole is apparently cemented, but certain companies specialize in resoling with their own adhesive. Good buy.
customer_reviews.author: J M

customer_reviews.title: Nice boots!
customer_reviews.text: I wear a lot of boots. Needed a nicer pair for winter for the office. Fit was great and style was what i was looking for. Usually don't buy Timberland products but very impressed with the quality. Nice job Timberland!
customer_reviews.author: David D.

customer_reviews.title: Nice, comfortable boots. Only a years worth of life though.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice set of boots. At first they came new looking pretty shiny, but after a couple weeks they had the nice Matte look my husband likes. He wore them for a year pretty much every day. The soles are already starting get holes and his feet get wet now. But he loved the style and said they were very comfortable. Will have to buy a new pair.
customer_reviews.author: Delissa Coureton

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: This boot is high quality, light and comfortable. After my first pair started suffering from wear from hiking and motorcycle-riding I got a new one. My main enthusiasm comes from the lightness which I particularly appreciate when hiking (which it isn't made for but works great), and the fact that I don't sweat in them. The only thing I would have wanted improved is the thickness of the sole. In order to improve this I got an insert-sole and now they're perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Runar

customer_reviews.title: Runs big and shipping wrong colors
customer_reviews.text: I bought these boots because I loved the style. I've returned and ordered new pairs 3 times thus far. Each time, the boot size is bigger than advertised. I'm usually an 11 men's. I'm down to 9.5 mens now and on top of the size issue, I order burnished Brown boots each time, but dark brown boots were shipped. Very disappointing service and sizing.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy J. Danna

customer_reviews.title: Yes! Buy them!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical after reading reviews saying they had bad stitching or were ripped. But I’m glad I bought them anyway. I wear a women’s 9 in converse and ordered a 7.5 in men’s and they fit perfectly with thin socks. And they have enough room to fit comfortably with thick socks. Shipped very quick considering I ordered them on Christmas Eve and got them today the 27th. (Will update again in a few months on wear and tear if so)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: Well it was $160.00 down the drain. I bought them in December for casual wear. In March the seems pulled apart. I thought Timberland made a quality product. They do not. Complete crap. I will never purchase these again or anything else Timberland makes. Extremely disappointed in these boots and the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: They really are that good!!
customer_reviews.text: Soft leather that caresses the foot like a favorite pair of boots you've been wearing for years. Even if Timberland had not made this commitment to Green manufacturing and packaging, I'd love these, but the highly ecologic production of this fine product endears them to me all the more. I have rarely experienced this much comfort in a boot like this, which accommodated my 4E/5E feet well: I did add my own orthotic foot bed to fine tune the fit. Now, I could wear these every day!
customer_reviews.author: pz51

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots! They are very confortable. I can wear these all day and feel very little fatigue. They are also warm but not too much. I have used these in the rain and have found no problema at all. The only real downside to these boots is that they are very slippery on certain types of floor, I have been about to fall a few times. If you plan on wearing these indoors be careful with wet tile.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Camilo Silva

product_meta.title: Timberland Men's Earthkeeper Original 6" Boot
product_meta.description:
Wondering about sizing? We recommend buying boots a size down from your usual sneaker size. So if you’re a sneaker size 11, order a size 10. Upper made with premium 100% full-grain leather from an LWG Silver-rated tannery. Breathable linings are made with 50% PET (recycled plastic bottles). Laces are made with 100% PET (recycled plastic bottles). Removable anti-fatigue footbeds with Gripstick™ rubber provide all-day comfort and support. Durable outsoles are made with 15% recycled rubber. Weight of a single boot (size 9): 1 pound, 3 ounces. Imported.

Timberland's Earthkeepers boots are original, rugged boots with a smaller environmental footprint than other shoes have. Timberland durability combined with lightweight versatility, along with linings made from recycled materials, outsoles made with recycled rubber and the all-day comfort of their exclusive Smart Comfort Biorhythmic system.

Timberland set new industry standards for craftsmanship, durability and protection when it introduced an authentic, waterproof leather boot in 1973. A global leader in design, engineering and marketing of premium footwear, Timberland values consumers who

See more
feature_bullets: These are our flagship Earthkeepers men's boots. We haven't sacrificed quality or rugged good looks to make them eco-conscious - their style and durable performance speak for themselves over seasons of wear.
ON THE TRAIL OR THE STREET, Timberland has the styles you'll love to wear. From ankle boots & sneaker boots to sandals & boat shoes, Timberland will keep you on your feet & looking fabulous.
TIMBERLAND HAS YOU COVERED whether you're looking for men's boots, women's boots, or kids boots. For the best in hiking boots, rain boots, work boots, casual shoes & boots & more, choose Timberland.
WHAT YOU NEED IN THE OUTDOORS: Timberland has the gear you need for all your outdoor adventures, including jackets and coats for outdoor activities, backpacks and luggage & outdoor accessories.

THE BEST IN OUTDOORS: Trust Timberland's line of high-quality men's, women's, and kids boots. hiking boots, outdoor gear, and activewear for all your activities from the trail to the sea to the streets.
